page.title: 07Framlingham Market Day
page.content: Saturday is market day in Framlingham. The market is held on Market Hill. Most people come regularly. The cost is $2.00 for a site but you have to bring your own stall. The charity stall costs only $1.00 if you come from Famlingham but $2.00 for outsiders. Some come from as far as Ipswich, which means setting up very early. Hardly anybody is about then but after a while the street fills and bustles with busy shoppers. Even so hardly any accidents happen. In winter you get less stalls which is just as well with ice on the roads. The market packs up at 5:00. The shops owners are all friendly and there is no trouble between the stalls and the shops. I like having a market because there are good bargains to be had. The Town Council owns the Market Hill and collectts the income from the stalls.
